intro: Grewia occidentalis, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green berries that ripen to a red color. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white flowers with five petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. The berries are edible and have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
